summary: Email correspondence between a law firm (Sullivan & Cromwell LLP) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding inquiries about efforts to recover funds for Jeffrey Epstein's victims and potential bank involvement. The email chain discusses a bank client's question about where to 'direct people' and speculates about Epstein's possible accounts at HSBC, JPMC, or DB.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The central subject of the inquiry; the email discusses potential efforts to recover funds for his victims and speculates about which banks may have held his money.

events.title: US Virgin Islands AG sues Epstein estate
events.description: The Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands filed a lawsuit against the estate of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A law firm inquired about efforts by the SDNY or DOJ to recover funds on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein's victims.
A victim compensation fund was established through the Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands following a lawsuit against the Epstein estate in January 2020.
The email chain references a bank client asking where to 'direct people,' with speculation that HSBC, JPMorgan Chase (JPMC), or Deutsche Bank (DB) may have been involved with Epstein's finances.
The correspondence questions why a bank would be asking about directing people and speculates Epstein may have had accounts there.
The email is from Sullivan & Cromwell LLP and is addressed to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
